abstract: Issue of corruption hovers over special elections to replaces New York Assemblyman Sheldon Silver and State Senator Dean Skelos; even as Democrats back Assemblyman Todd Kaminsky to take over Skelos's seat, citing his record as former federal corruption prosecutor, Democratic frontrunner in race to replace Silver is Alice Cancel, who has praised Silver as hero.
lead_paragraph: On April 19, voters will choose successors to Sheldon Silver, the former Assembly speaker, and Dean G. Skelos, the former Senate majority leader, both of whom were convicted on corruption charges.

headline.main: Specter of Corruption Hangs Over Special Elections for New York Legislature
headline.print_headline: Specter of Corruption Hangs Over Special Elections for Legislature

snippet: On April 19, voters will choose successors to Sheldon Silver, the former Assembly speaker, and Dean G. Skelos, the former Senate majority leader, both of whom were convicted on corruption charges.
